intro: Hadrolaelia xanthina, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a species native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features a slender, upright stem with a few leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. It is known for its vibrant color and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
